page.title: 01Sebergham General Review
page.content: This upland area with sparse pop- ulation, rising to 303 metres, lies 10 miles SSW of Carlisle and is a mainly grass farming area. Cultivation is restricted to fodder for stock. The economy is tied to fluctuations in milk production, suckler herds and lamb production, all of which are influenced by government policy as much as by the weather. Many of the houses, which were either farms themselves or farm workers cottages, are now occupied by families who work in the local towns of Carlisle, Penrith and Wigton. Growing numbers of tourists both pass through or stay in the area, some of the houses being let for summer holidays and creating a useful add- ition to farm incomes, where the farm no longer has its own hired labour.
